dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Netflix filing for bankruptcy? That just seems... I don't know, hard to wrap my head around. They were untouchable for so long.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Netflix filing for bankruptcy? That just seems... I don't know, hard to wrap my head around. They were untouchable for so long.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Though they took a small hit amid the broader market's September correctionafter an all-time Netflix high in late Augustshares of the Los Gatos, California-based firm are once again nearing peak levels.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: I know, but look at the numbers—$23.5 billion market cap right before they file. That's down nearly $200 billion just this year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, but look at the numbers-twenty three point five dollars billion market cap right before they file. That's down nearly two hundred dollars billion just this year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: $235 Billion That's Netflix's market capitalization the day before it's set to release third-quarter earnings. It's up nearly $100 billion in 2020 alone, making the 23-year-old streaming giant one of the 20 largest companies on the S&P 500 by market capahead of even media mainstays like Walt Disney, Comcast and AT&T.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but a 60% drop in their stock? The whole market's been a mess, the S&P is down 65%.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but a sixty percent drop in their stock? The whole market's been a mess, the S&P is down sixty five percent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 60% Netflix shares have soared more than 60% since the beginning of the year. To compare, the S&P 500 is up just 6.5% in 2020.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: True, but Netflix is getting hit way harder in key areas. They're expecting to report only 95 million subscribers Tuesday, which is 2.5 million fewer than last quarter.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True, but Netflix is getting hit way harder in key areas. They're expecting to report only ninety five million subscribers Tuesday, which is two point five million fewer than last quarter.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 195 Million That's the number of paid subscribers analysts expect Netflix will report on Tuesday, up 2.5 million quarter to quarter and in line with the firm's latest guidance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, but didn't they lose a ton of subscribers earlier this year too? Like 26 million in the first half?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, but didn't they lose a ton of subscribers earlier this year too? Like twenty six million in the first half?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Netflix said in July that it added 26 million subscribers during the first half of the year (10 million in the first quarter and nearly 16 million in the second) as homebound consumers facing government-mandated quarantine orders turned to the streaming giantand away from movie theaters and live showsfor entertainment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, and analysts think even that 95 million might be optimistic. CFRA reiterated its sell rating, worrying about international subscriber drops.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, and analysts think even that ninety five million might be optimistic. C F R A reiterated its sell rating, worrying about international subscriber drops.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That increase could even prove conservative, noted investment research firm CFRA on Monday, reiterating its buy rating on Netflix shares and adding that the firm could be bolstered by an increase in subscribers from international markets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Still, revenue's projected around $640 million this quarter. That's not nothing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, revenue's projected around six hundred forty dollars million this quarter. That's not nothing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: $6.4 Billion Analysts are expecting Netflix will pull nearly $6.4 billion in third-quarter revenues, up more than 20% from the same period last year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's down over 20% from last year though. And they're expected to post a loss per share, negative $2.13.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's down over twenty percent from last year though. And they're expected to post a loss per share, negative two point one three dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The company's also expected to report earnings of about $2.13 per share, down from $1.47 per share last year on heightened costs amid the pandemic.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: What about Bank of America's price target? Did they adjust it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: What about Bank of America's price target? Did they adjust it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: They slashed it to $6.70—lowest on Wall Street. Down from like $575 before.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They slashed it to six point seven zero dollars-lowest on Wall Street. Down from like five hundred seventy five dollars before.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: $670 That's the price target Bank of America issued on Friday for Netflix, up nearly 17% from a prior target of $575 and representing the highest Netflix price target on Wall Street.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Oof. And Reed Hastings lost almost $2 billion personally?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oof. And Reed Hastings lost almost two dollars billion personally?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The firm's billionaire cofounder and CEO, Reed Hastings, has gotten nearly $2 billion during the pandemic.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, his net worth is down to around $54 million now. Wild for someone who owned 90% of the company.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, his net worth is down to around fifty four dollars million now. Wild for someone who owned ninety percent of the company.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The 60-year-old, who launched Netflix as a DVD subscription service in 1997 and owns roughly 1% of its shares, is now worth about $5.4 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So you really think this is more than just a bad year? Like, structural decline?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So you really think this is more than just a bad year? Like, structural decline?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: With theaters reopening and competition heating up? It's looking pretty grim. Even their average analyst price target is barely above current trading.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: With theaters reopening and competition heating up? It's looking pretty grim. Even their average analyst price target is barely above current trading.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Netflix's average price target from 39 analysts covering its stock is about $527within 1% of current prices.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Man. End of an era, huh?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Man. End of an era, huh?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Feels that way. We'll see what the bankruptcy filing actually reveals Tuesday.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Feels that way. We'll see what the bankruptcy filing actually reveals Tuesday.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: With the firm set to report earnings Tuesday after the market close, here are five numbers that show just how much the firm has dominated entertainment in the pandemic age.

artist_script:
HostA: Netflix filing for bankruptcy? That just seems... I don't know, hard to wrap my head around. They were untouchable for so long.
HostB: I know, but look at the numbers—$23.5 billion market cap right before they file. That’s down nearly $200 billion just this year.
HostA: Yeah, but a 60% drop in their stock? The whole market’s been a mess, the S&P is down 65%.
HostB: True, but Netflix is getting hit way harder in key areas. They’re expecting to report only 95 million subscribers Tuesday, which is 2.5 million fewer than last quarter.
HostA: Okay, but didn’t they lose a ton of subscribers earlier this year too? Like 26 million in the first half?
HostB: Exactly, and analysts think even that 95 million might be optimistic. CFRA reiterated its sell rating, worrying about international subscriber drops.
HostA: Still, revenue’s projected around $640 million this quarter. That’s not nothing.
HostB: It’s down over 20% from last year though. And they’re expected to post a loss per share, negative $2.13.
HostA: What about Bank of America’s price target? Did they adjust it?
HostB: They slashed it to $6.70—lowest on Wall Street. Down from like $575 before.
HostA: Oof. And Reed Hastings lost almost $2 billion personally?
HostB: Yeah, his net worth is down to around $54 million now. Wild for someone who owned 90% of the company.
HostA: So you really think this is more than just a bad year? Like, structural decline?
HostB: With theaters reopening and competition heating up? It’s looking pretty grim. Even their average analyst price target is barely above current trading.
HostA: Man. End of an era, huh?
HostB: Feels that way. We’ll see what the bankruptcy filing actually reveals Tuesday.
